The solution utilizes industry's leading Cloud-enabled application provisioning solution, VMware vFabric Application Director that takes a model-driven open approach to drastically simplify and automate application deployment topologies of multi-tier complex application in hybrid clouds. The product enables rapid deployments using reusable standardizing application configurations encapsulated in portable cloud application blueprints.

ns9:component-version-script.script:
#!/bin/bash ############################################################################# # NAME # configure.sh # # LAST MODIFIED # 27-June-2012 # # SYNOPSIS # # DESCRIPTION # This script configures the liferay portal # # USAGE # Following environment variables are needed by this script: # 1. global_conf : This is the path to the file https://${darwin.server.ip}:8443/darwin/conf/darwin_global.conf # on the appdirector server # # LICENSE # # AUTHOR # Shweta Malhotra # Persistent Systems Limited ################################################################################################# # Enables checking of all commands. If a command exits with an error(non-zero status) # and the caller does not check such error, the script aborts immediately set -x set -e
# Import Global conf . $global_conf
export PATH="$PATH:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin"
#Environment variable LIFERAY_HOME=/opt/liferay/liferay-portal-6.1.1-ce-ga2 LIFERAY_TOMCAT_HOME=$LIFERAY_HOME/tomcat-7.0.27
## MySQL integration mysql_integration=${mysql_integration:-"no"} ;
# Set variables config_file=portal-ext.properties
# Update host file address=`ifconfig |grep "inet addr" |grep -v "127.0.0.1" |awk '{print $2;}' |awk -F':' '{print $2;}'` echo $address `hostname`>>/etc/hosts
# Congigure properties of liferay echo "Updating configuration file" touch $LIFERAY_HOME/$config_file echo "setup.wizard.enabled=false" > $LIFERAY_HOME/$config_file echo "Updating configuration file...Done"
###----------- helper functions Begin-----------### function do_ldap_integration() { #properties configured in liferay for openldap settings echo " ldap.auth.enabled=true ldap.base.provider.url=ldap://$ldap_server_ip:389 ldap.base.dn=$ldap_base_dn ldap.security.principal=$ldap_security_principal ldap.security.credentials=$ldap_security_credentials ldap.users.dn=$ldap_users_dn ldap.groups.dn=$ldap_groups_dn ldap.auth.required=false ldap.attrs.transformer.impl=com.liferay.portal.security.ldap.DefaultAttributesTransformer ldap.import.enabled=true ldap.import.on.startup=true ldap.import.interval=10 ldap.import.method=user ldap.import.user.password.enabled=true ldap.factory.initial=com.sun.jndi.ldap.LdapCtxFactory ldap.referral=follow ldap.import.user.search.filter=(objectClass=inetOrgPerson) ldap.import.group.search.filter=(objectClass=groupOfUniqueNames) ldap.group.mappings=groupName=cn\ndescription=description\nuser=uniqueMember company.security.auth.type=emailAddress ldap.auth.search.filter=(mail=@email_address@) ldap.export.enabled=false ldap.password.policy.enabled=false ldap.user.mappings=uuid=uuid\nscreenName=sn\npassword=userPassword\nemailAddress=mail\nfirstName=givenName\nlastName=sn\njobTitle=title\nfullName=cn\ngroup=groupMembership ldap.user.impl=com.liferay.portal.security.ldap.LDAPUser ldap.user.default.object.classes=top,person,inetOrgPerson,organizationalPerson ldap.group.mappings=groupName=cn\ndescription=description\nuser=memberUid ldap.auth.method=bind ldap.import.group.search.filter.enabled=false ldap.import.group.cache.enabled=true ldap.group.default.object.classes=top,groupOfUniqueNames" >> $LIFERAY_HOME/$config_file }
do_mysql_integration() { # MySQL JDBC Connector Location connector_location=$mysql_connector
cp $LIFERAY_HOME/portal-ext.properties $LIFERAY_HOME/portal-ext.properties.bak cp $LIFERAY_TOMCAT_HOME/conf/Catalina/localhost/ROOT.xml $LIFERAY_TOMCAT_HOME/conf/Catalina/localhost/ROOT.xml.bak
#Configuring Liferay for Mysql JDBC driver mysql_connector_jar=`tar -tzf $mysql_connector | grep -e "mysql-connector-java.*bin\.jar$"` ; #get the path of connector jar file inside the archive tar -xzf $mysql_connector $mysql_connector_jar ;# This will extract the required jar with the path inside archive in cwd cp $mysql_connector_jar $LIFERAY_TOMCAT_HOME/lib/ext
#properties configured in liferay for database settings echo "jdbc.default.jndi.name=jdbc/LiferayPool jdbc.default.driverClassName=com.mysql.jdbc.Driver jdbc.default.url=jdbc:mysql://$mysql_server_name/$mysql_database_name?useUnicode=true&characterEncoding=UTF-8&useFastDateParsing=false jdbc.default.username=$mysql_user_name jdbc.default.password=$mysql_password" >> $LIFERAY_HOME/portal-ext.properties
sed '$d' $LIFERAY_TOMCAT_HOME/conf/Catalina/localhost/ROOT.xml > $LIFERAY_TOMCAT_HOME/conf/Catalina/localhost/ROOT.xml.tmp mv $LIFERAY_TOMCAT_HOME/conf/Catalina/localhost/ROOT.xml.tmp $LIFERAY_TOMCAT_HOME/conf/Catalina/localhost/ROOT.xml echo "<Resource name=\"jdbc/LiferayPool\" auth=\"Container\" type=\"javax.sql.DataSource\" driverClassName=\"com.mysql.jdbc.Driver\" url=\"jdbc:mysql://$mysql_server_name/$mysql_database_name?useUnicode=true&characterEncoding=UTF-8\" username=\"$mysql_user_name\" password=\"$mysql_password\" maxActive=\"100\" maxIdle=\"30\" maxWait=\"10000\" /> </Context> " >> $LIFERAY_TOMCAT_HOME/conf/Catalina/localhost/ROOT.xml }
do_alfresco_integration() { echo "Doing configuration for alfresco integration.." #1. Deploy share.war to LIFERAY_HOME/deploy folder mkdir -p $LIFERAY_HOME/deploy cp -f $alfresco_share_war_url $LIFERAY_HOME/deploy/ ls -l $LIFERAY_HOME/deploy/ echo "Alfresco share.war deployed to Liferay"
#2. Set share.loader property in LIFERAY_TOMCAT_HOME/conf/catalina.properties search_pattern="^\s*\#?\s*shared.loader.*" replace_string="shared.loader=$\{catalina.home\}/shared/classes,$\{catalina.home\}/shared/lib/*.jar" sed -r -i -e "s%$search_pattern%$replace_string%g" $LIFERAY_TOMCAT_HOME/conf/catalina.properties echo "Edited $LIFERAY_TOMCAT_HOME/conf/catalina.properties file"
#3. Create web-extension directory and add the configuration for alfresco mkdir -p $LIFERAY_TOMCAT_HOME/shared/classes/alfresco/web-extension touch $LIFERAY_TOMCAT_HOME/shared/classes/alfresco/web-extension/share-config-custom.xml #cat <<ALF_CONFIG > $LIFERAY_TOMCAT_HOME/shared/classes/alfresco/web-extension/share-config-custom.xml ALF_CONFIG=" <alfresco-config> <!-- Overriding endpoints to reference a remote Alfresco server --> <config evaluator=\"string-compare\" condition=\"Remote\"> <remote> <endpoint> <id>alfresco-noauth</id> <name>Alfresco - unauthenticated access</name> <description>Access to Alfresco Repository WebScripts that do not require authentication</description> <connector-id>alfresco</connector-id> <endpoint-url>http://$alfresco_server_ip:8080/alfresco/s</endpoint-url> <identity>none</identity> </endpoint>
<endpoint> <id>alfresco-feed</id> <name>Alfresco Feed</name> <description>Alfresco Feed - supports basic HTTP authentication</description> <connector-id>http</connector-id> <endpoint-url>http://$alfresco_server_ip:8080/alfresco/s</endpoint-url> <basic-auth>true</basic-auth> <identity>user</identity> </endpoint> <connector> <id>alfrescoCookie</id> <name>Alfresco Connector</name> <description>Connects to an Alfresco instance using cookie-based authentication</description> <class>org.springframework.extensions.webscripts.connector.AlfrescoConnector</class> </connector>
<endpoint> <id>alfresco</id> <name>Alfresco - user access</name> <description>Access to Alfresco Repository WebScripts that require user authentication</description> <connector-id>alfrescoCookie</connector-id> <endpoint-url>http://$alfresco_server_ip:8080/alfresco/wcs</endpoint-url> <identity>user</identity> <external-auth>true</external-auth> </endpoint> </remote> </config> </alfresco-config> " ;# echo $ALF_CONFIG > $LIFERAY_TOMCAT_HOME/shared/classes/alfresco/web-extension/share-config-custom.xml echo "Alfresco configuration added to $LIFERAY_TOMCAT_HOME/shared/classes/alfresco/web-extension/share-config-custom.xml" }
# MySQL Integration if [ $mysql_integration == "yes" ] ; then echo "MySQL integration enabled" do_mysql_integration fi
# OpenLDAP Integration if [ $ldap_integration == "yes" ] ; then echo "LDAP integration enabled" do_ldap_integration fi
# Alfresco Integration if [ $alfresco_integration == "yes" ] ; then echo "Alfresco integration enabled" do_alfresco_integration echo "Alfresco integration done..." fi

#!/bin/bash ################################################################################################# # NAME # start.sh # # LAST MODIFIED # 27-June-2012 # # SYNOPSIS # # DESCRIPTION # This script starts the Liferay Portal # # USAGE # Following environment variables are needed by this script: # 1. global_conf : This is the path to the file https://${darwin.server.ip}:8443/darwin/conf/darwin_global.conf # on the appdirector server. # # LICENSE # # AUTHOR # Shweta Malhotra # Persistent Systems Limited ################################################################################################# # Enables checking of all commands. If a command exits with an error(non-zero status) # and the caller does not check such error, the script aborts immediately set -x set -e
# Import Global conf . $global_conf
export PATH="$PATH:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin" export LIFERAY_HOME="/opt/liferay/liferay-portal-6.1.1-ce-ga2" export LIFERAY_TOMCAT_HOME="$LIFERAY_HOME/tomcat-7.0.27"
#----Function definition start here ---------------------- wait_for_tomcat_startup() { if [ "x$1" == "x" ] ; then # is parameter #1 is of zero length or it is not passed echo "TOMCAT HOME unknown" echo "Unable to determine tomcat startup status" exit 1 fi tomcat_home=$1 if [ ! -e $tomcat_home ] ; then # Is tomcat directory exists echo "Directory '$tomcat_home' does not exists" exit 1 fi # Wait for tomcat server to start completely echo "Checking tomcat startup status..." tomcat_startup_timeout_time=${tomcat_startup_timeout_time:-2400} ;#default value 2400 seconds ,40 minutes interval=60 ;# 60 seconds interval between lookups tomcat_log=$tomcat_home/logs/catalina.out touch $tomcat_log ;# Create the log file in case it is not created no_of_lines=$(wc -l $tomcat_log | awk '{print $1}');# Get number of lines in tomcat log file so as to lookup server startup message after that point t1=`date +%s` ;# Capture current time in seconds since 1970-01-01 00:00:00 UTC while [ 1 ] do sleep $interval ; # sleep for sometime before checking Server startup message t2=`date +%s`; #Capture current time in seconds since 1970-01-01 00:00:00 UTC echo "Checking tomcat startup after $[$t2-$t1] seconds..." if [ $[$t2-$t1] -ge $tomcat_startup_timeout_time ] ; then echo "Tomcat server did not start even after $timeout_time seconds" echo "Please see the logs '$tomcat_log' to find the root cause" exit 1 fi
# Check server startup message in log file. If found then come out of while loop if tail -n +$[$no_of_lines + 1] $tomcat_log | grep -n "Server startup in" >> /dev/null ; then echo "Tomcat server startup completed" break ;#Server startup completed fi done }
#--- function definition ends here
#- Main startup_script=$LIFERAY_TOMCAT_HOME/bin/startup.sh if [ ! -f $startup_script ] ; then echo "Tomcat startup script not present" exit 1 else $startup_script # Wait for tomcat to startup by monitoring tomcat server log file wait_for_tomcat_startup $LIFERAY_TOMCAT_HOME echo "Liferay started successfully..." fi
# Deploy share.war in liferay deploy folder if alfresco integration is enabled # This is again done in start step as it is seen that when liferay starts it cleans up deploy folder # ls -l is put just to log that if [ $alfresco_integration == "yes" ] ; then echo "Alfresco integration enabled" ls -l $LIFERAY_HOME/deploy/ cp -f $alfresco_share_war_url $LIFERAY_HOME/deploy/ ls -l $LIFERAY_HOME/deploy/ echo "Alfresco share.war deployed to Liferay" fi

#!/bin/bash ############################################################################# # NAME # install.sh # # LAST MODIFIED # 27-June-2012 # # SYNOPSIS # # DESCRIPTION # This script installs the liferay portal bundle # The following packages are installed # liferay-portal-6.1.0 # tomcat-7.0.23 # # USAGE # global_conf : This is the path to the file https://${darwin.server.ip}:8443/darwin/conf/darwin_global.conf # on the appdirector server # installer_url : The URL from where the liferay installer can be downloaded # (liferay-portal-tomcat-6.1.0-ce-ga1-20120106155615760.zip) # LICENSE # # AUTHOR # Shweta Malhotra # Persistent Systems Limited ################################################################################################# # Enables checking of all commands. If a command exits with an error(non-zero status) # and the caller does not check such error, the script aborts immediately set -x set -e
# Import Global conf . $global_conf
export PATH="$PATH:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin"
#- Check validity of OS if [ "x$OS" = "x" ] ; then echo "Unknown OS" exit 1 elif [ $OS != 'CentOS' ] ; then echo "This OS is not supported" exit 1 fi
# Validate Mandatory Arguments if [ "x$installer_url" = "x" ] ; then echo "Mandatory Property 'installer_url' is not defined " exit 1 fi
# Validate Mandatory Arguments for MySql integration mysql_integration=${mysql_integration:-"no"} #mandatory_args = ( mysql_database_name mysql_user_name mysql_password mysql_connector mysql_server_name ) if [ $mysql_integration == "yes" ] ; then error_message="" if [ "x$mysql_database_name" = "x" ] ; then error_message="$error_message
Mandatory Property 'mysql_database_name' is not defined for mysql integration " fi if [ "x$mysql_user_name" = "x" ] ; then error_message="$error_message
Mandatory Property 'mysql_user_name' is not defined for mysql integration " fi if [ "x$mysql_password" = "x" ] ; then error_message="$error_message
Mandatory Property 'mysql_password' is not defined for mysql integration " fi if [ "x$mysql_connector" = "x" ] ; then error_message="$error_message
Mandatory Property 'mysql_connector' is not defined for mysql integration " fi if [ "x$mysql_server_name" = "x" ] ; then error_message="$error_message
Mandatory Property 'mysql_server_name' is not defined for mysql integration " fi if [ "x$error_message" != "x" ] ; then echo -e $error_message exit 1 fi fi
# Validate Mandatory Arguments for LDAP integration ldap_integration=${ldap_integration:-"no"} ; #mandatory_args = ( ldap_auth_enabled ldap_server_ip ldap_base_dn ldap_security_principal ldap_security_credentials ldap_users_dn ldap_groups_dn ) if [ $ldap_integration == "yes" ] ; then error_message="" if [ "x$ldap_server_ip" = "x" ] ; then error_message="$error_message
Mandatory Property 'ldap_server_ip' is not defined for LDAP integration" fi if [ "x$ldap_base_dn" = "x" ] ; then error_message="$error_message
Mandatory Property 'ldap_base_dn' is not defined for LDAP integration" fi if [ "x$ldap_security_principal" = "x" ] ; then error_message="$error_message
Mandatory Property 'ldap_security_principal' is not defined for LDAP integration" fi if [ "x$ldap_security_credentials" = "x" ] ; then error_message="$error_message
Mandatory Property 'ldap_security_credentials' is not defined for LDAP integration" fi if [ "x$ldap_users_dn" = "x" ] ; then error_message="$error_message
Mandatory Property 'ldap_users_dn' is not defined for LDAP integration" fi if [ "x$ldap_groups_dn" = "x" ] ; then error_message="$error_message
Mandatory Property 'ldap_groups_dn' is not defined for LDAP integration" fi if [ "x$error_message" != "x" ] ; then echo -e $error_message exit 1 fi fi
# Validate Mandatory Arguments for Alfresco integration alfresco_integration=${alfresco_integration:-"no"} #mandatory_args = ( alfresco_share_war_url alfresco_server_ip ) if [ $alfresco_integration == "yes" ] ; then error_message="" if [ "x$alfresco_share_war_url" = "x" ] ; then error_message="$error_message
Mandatory Property 'alfresco_share_war_url' is not defined for LDAP integration" fi if [ "x$alfresco_server_ip" = "x" ] ; then error_message="$error_message
Mandatory Property 'alfresco_server_ip' is not defined for LDAP integration" fi if [ "x$error_message" != "x" ] ; then echo -e $error_message exit 1 fi fi
echo "Installing pre-requisites" yum install -y unzip
# Liferay Location mkdir /opt/liferay
echo "Extracting installer" unzip $installer_url -d /opt/liferay if [ "$?" == "0" ] ; then echo "Liferay Installer successfully unzipped" else echo "Error unzipping Liferay installer" fi
# Set properties to be used by later lifecycle stages LIFERAY_HOME=/opt/liferay/liferay-portal-6.1.1-ce-ga2 LIFERAY_TOMCAT_HOME=$LIFERAY_HOME/tomcat-7.0.27

ns9:component-version-script.script:
#!/bin/bash ################################################################################################# # NAME # install.sh # # LAST MODIFIED # 27-June-2012 # # SYNOPSIS # # DESCRIPTION # This script installs Alfresco Enterprise Bundle. This Script is written only for Alfresco Enterprise 4.0.1 # bundle # # ENVIRONMENT # Following environment variables are needed by this script: # 1. global_conf : This is the path to the file https://${darwin.server.ip}:8443/darwin/conf/darwin_global.conf # on the appdirector server # LICENSE # # AUTHOR # Ankur Goel # Persistent Systems Limited ################################################################################################# # Enables checking of all commands. If a command exits with an error(non-zero status) # and the caller does not check such error, the script aborts immediately set -e set -x
# Import Global conf . $global_conf
export PATH="$PATH:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin"
#- Check validity of OS if [ "x$OS" = "x" ] ; then echo "Unknown OS" exit 1 elif [ $OS != 'CentOS' ] ; then echo "This OS is not supported" exit 1 fi
# Validate Mandatory Arguments if [ "x$alfresco_admin_password" = "x" ] ; then echo "Mandatory Property 'alfresco_admin_password' is not defined " exit 1 fi if [ "x$installer_url" = "x" ] ; then echo "Mandatory Property 'installer_url' is not defined " exit 1 fi
# Validate Mandatory Arguments for MySql integration mysql_integration=${mysql_integration:-"no"} #mandatory_args = ( mysql_db_name mysql_db_username mysql_db_password mysql_connector mysql_db_driver mysql_server_ip ) if [ $mysql_integration == "yes" ] ; then error_message="" if [ "x$mysql_db_name" = "x" ] ; then error_message="$error_message\nMandatory Property 'mysql_db_name' is not defined for mysql integration" fi if [ "x$mysql_db_username" = "x" ] ; then error_message="$error_message\nMandatory Property 'mysql_db_username' is not defined for mysql integration" fi if [ "x$mysql_db_password" = "x" ] ; then error_message="$error_message\nMandatory Property 'mysql_db_password' is not defined for mysql integration " fi if [ "x$mysql_db_driver" = "x" ] ; then error_message="$error_message\nMandatory Property 'mysql_db_driver' is not defined for mysql integration " fi if [ "x$mysql_connector" = "x" ] ; then error_message="$error_message\nMandatory Property 'mysql_connector' is not defined for mysql integration " fi if [ "x$mysql_server_ip" = "x" ] ; then error_message="$error_message\nMandatory Property 'mysql_server_ip' is not defined for mysql integration " fi if [ "x$error_message" != "x" ] ; then echo -e $error_message exit 1 fi fi
# Install the application if [ ! -f $installer_url ] ; then # Check if Alfresco Installer file exists echo "Application installer not found." exit 1 else echo "Setting execute permissions for installer" chmod +x $installer_url
echo "Installing Alfresco Enterprise" if [ $mysql_integration == "yes" ] ; then echo "MySQL integration enabled for alfresco" echo "Installing Alfresco with MySQL integration enabled" jdbc_url="jdbc:mysql://$mysql_server_ip/$mysql_db_name?useUnicode=yes&characterEncoding=UTF-8" install_command="$installer_url --mode unattended --alfresco_admin_password $alfresco_admin_password --disable-components postgres --jdbc_url $jdbc_url --jdbc_database $mysql_db_name --jdbc_username $mysql_db_username --jdbc_password $mysql_db_password --jdbc_driver $mysql_db_driver " else install_command="$installer_url --mode unattended --alfresco_admin_password $alfresco_admin_password" fi echo "Installation Started at `date`" echo "Executing command '$install_command' to install alfresco" $install_command echo "Installation completed at `date`"
# Set properties required by other lifecycle stages ALFRESCO_HOME=/opt/alfresco-4.1.5 ALFRESCO_TOMCAT_HOME=$ALFRESCO_HOME/tomcat
# allow non tty sessions #sed -i 's/Defaults requiretty/#Defaults requiretty/g' /etc/sudoers fi

#!/bin/bash ################################################################################################# # NAME # start.sh # # LAST MODIFIED # 27-June-2012 # # SYNOPSIS # # DESCRIPTION # This script installs Alfresco Enterprise Bundle # # USAGE # Following environment variables are needed by this script: # 1. global_conf : This is the path to the file https://${darwin.server.ip}:8443/darwin/conf/darwin_global.conf # on the appdirector server # LICENSE # # AUTHOR # Ankur Goel # Persistent Systems Limited ################################################################################################# # Enables checking of all commands. If a command exits with an error(non-zero status) # and the caller does not check such error, the script aborts immediately set -e set -x
# set -u, will exit your script if you try to use an uninitialised variable set -u
# Import Global conf . $global_conf
export PATH="$PATH:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin"
#Environment variable ALFRESCO_HOME=/opt/alfresco-4.1.5 ALFRESCO_TOMCAT_HOME=$ALFRESCO_HOME/tomcat
# start the alfresco service /etc/init.d/alfresco start
# Check alfresco tomcat startup echo "Checking alfresco tomcat startup...." # Wait for tomcat server to start completely tomcat_startup_timeout_time=${tomcat_startup_timeout_time:-2400} ;#default value 2400 seconds ,40 minutes interval=60 ;# 30 seconds interval between lookups tomcat_log=$ALFRESCO_TOMCAT_HOME/logs/catalina.out touch $tomcat_log ;# Create the log file in case it is not created no_of_lines=$(wc -l $tomcat_log | awk '{print $1}');# Get number of lines in tomcat log file t1=`date +%s` ;# Capture current time in seconds since 1970-01-01 00:00:00 UTC while [ 1 ] do sleep $interval ; # sleep for sometime before checking Server startup message t2=`date +%s`; #Capture current time in seconds since 1970-01-01 00:00:00 UTC echo "Checking Alfresco tomcat startup after $[$t2-$t1] seconds..." if [ $[$t2-$t1] -ge $tomcat_startup_timeout_time ] ; then echo "Tomcat server did not start even after $timeout_time seconds" echo "Please see the logs '$tomcat_log' to find the root cause" exit 1 fi
# Check server staartup message in log file. If found then come out of while loop if tail -n +$[$no_of_lines + 1] $tomcat_log | grep -n "Server startup in" >> /dev/null ; then echo "Tomcat server startup completed" break ;#Server startup completed fi done
# If we come here then tomcat is successfully started. # There are chances Alfresco may not have started. # Make sure Alfresco is really really running. echo "Checking java process running status" if ! ps -ef | grep java | grep alfresco ; then echo "Tomcat server stopped after starting up successfully." echo "Please see the logs '$tomcat_log' to find the root cause" exit 1 fi
echo "Alfresco service started successfully...."

#!/bin/bash ################################################################################################# # NAME # configure.sh # # LAST MODIFIED # 27-June-2012 # # SYNOPSIS # # DESCRIPTION # This script installs Alfresco Enterprise Bundle # with optional liferay integration # # USAGE # Following environment variables are needed by this script: # 1. global_conf : This is the path to the file https://${darwin.server.ip}:8443/darwin/conf/darwin_global.conf # on the appdirector server # LICENSE # # AUTHOR # Ankur Goel # Persistent Systems Limited ################################################################################################# # Enables checking of all commands. If a command exits with an error(non-zero status) # and the caller does not check such error, the script aborts immediately set -e set -x
# Import Global conf . $global_conf
export PATH="$PATH:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin"
# Set properties required by other lifecycle stages ALFRESCO_HOME=/opt/alfresco-4.1.5 ALFRESCO_TOMCAT_HOME=$ALFRESCO_HOME/tomcat
# Update host file address=`ifconfig |grep "inet addr" |grep -v "127.0.0.1" |awk '{print $2;}' |awk -F':' '{print $2;}'` echo $address `hostname`>>/etc/hosts echo "hosts file updated"
# Integrate with liferay if enabled liferay_integration=${liferay_integration:-"no"} ; if [ "$liferay_integration" == "yes" ] ; then echo "Liferay integration enabled" alfresco_properties_file=$ALFRESCO_TOMCAT_HOME/shared/classes/alfresco-global.properties echo "" >> $alfresco_properties_file echo "authentication.chain=alfrescoNtlm1:alfrescoNtlm,external1:external" >> $alfresco_properties_file echo "external.authentication.proxyUserName=" >> $alfresco_properties_file mkdir -p $ALFRESCO_TOMCAT_HOME/webapps/integration cp $ALFRESCO_TOMCAT_HOME/webapps/share.war $ALFRESCO_TOMCAT_HOME/webapps/integration echo "share.war available at http://<alfresco IP>:8080/integration/share.war" fi
#Integrate with MySQL if enabled mysql_integration=${mysql_integration:-"no"} ; if [ $mysql_integration == "yes" ] ; then echo "MySQL intregration enabled" #Configuring alfresco for Mysql JDBC driver mysql_connector_jar=`tar -tzf $mysql_connector | grep -e "mysql-connector-java.*bin\.jar$"` ; tar -xzf $mysql_connector $mysql_connector_jar ; cp $mysql_connector_jar $ALFRESCO_TOMCAT_HOME/lib fi

#!/bin/bash ################################################################################################# # NAME # configure.sh # # LAST MODIFIED # 27-June-2012 # # SYNOPSIS # # DESCRIPTION # This script assumes that openldap is installed and configures the openldap by editing its # configuration file. # # USAGE # Following parameters are used by this script: # database : OpenLDAP database type. # suffix : The base DN for the OpenLDAP server # root_cn : The CN for the root user. This suffix will be added to the CN to form the root DN # root_pw : Password for the OpenLDAP root user. This will be encrypted and saved to the config file. # global_conf : This is the path to the file https://${darwin.server.ip}:8443/darwin/conf/darwin_global.conf # on the appdirector server # # LICENSE # # AUTHOR # Ankur Goel # Persistent Systems Limited ################################################################################################# # Enables checking of all commands. If a command exits with an error(non-zero status) # and the caller does not check such error, the script aborts immediately set -e
# Import Global conf . $global_conf
export PATH="$PATH:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin"
# Set variables database=${database:-"bdb"} base_dn=${suffix:-"dc=ldap,dc=vmware,dc=com"} root_cn=${rootcn:-"cn=manager"} root_pw=${rootpw:-"vmware"}
# Openldap configuration file my_cnf_file="/etc/openldap/slapd.conf"
# Check if configuration file exists if [ ! -f $my_cnf_file ] ; then echo "openldap configuration file not present" exit 1 else echo Using $my_cnf_file fi
# Backup configuration file echo "Backing up config file" cp -f ${my_cnf_file} ${my_cnf_file}.backup ;
if [ "x$OS" != "x" ] && [ $OS = 'CentOS' ] ; then echo "Setting configuration parameters" # Set OpenLDAP database search_pattern="^\s*\#?\s*database.*" replace_string="database\t\t\"$database\"" sed -r -i -e "s%$search_pattern%$replace_string%g" $my_cnf_file echo "database : $database"
# Set directory base DN search_pattern="^\s*\#?\s*suffix.*" replace_string="suffix\t\t\"$base_dn\"" sed -r -i -e "s%$search_pattern%$replace_string%g" $my_cnf_file echo "suffix : $base_dn"
# Set root distinguished name search_pattern="^\s*\#?\s*rootdn.*cn.*" replace_string="rootdn\t\t\"$root_cn,$base_dn\"" sed -r -i -e "s%$search_pattern%$replace_string%g" $my_cnf_file echo "rootdn : $root_cn,$base_dn"
# Set root password encrypted_root_pw=`/usr/sbin/slappasswd -s $root_pw` search_pattern="^\s*\#?\s*rootpw.*" replace_string="rootpw\t\t$encrypted_root_pw" sed -r -i -e "s%$search_pattern%$replace_string%g" $my_cnf_file echo "rootpw : ******"
# Set appropriate permission for database directory db_dir=/var/lib/ldap chmod 700 $db_dir chown -R ldap $db_dir echo "database permissions set"
# Use chkconfig to configure LDAP to start at boot time chkconfig --level 35 ldap on echo "start on boot configured" else echo "This operating system is not supported" exit 1 fi

#!/bin/bash ################################################################################################# # NAME # start.sh # # LAST MODIFIED # 27-June-2012 # # SYNOPSIS # # DESCRIPTION # This script starts the openldap service # # USAGE # Following environment variables are needed by this script: # global_conf : This is the path to the file https://${darwin.server.ip}:8443/darwin/conf/darwin_global.conf # on the appdirector server # # LICENSE # # AUTHOR # Ankur Goel # Persistent Systems Limited ################################################################################################# # Enable checking of all commands. If a command exits with an error(non-zero status) # and the caller does not check such error, the script aborts immediately set -e
# Import Global conf . $global_conf
export PATH="$PATH:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin"
# start the openldap service if [ "x$OS" != "x" ] && [ $OS = 'CentOS' ] ; then /sbin/service ldap restart else echo "This operating system is not supported" exit 1 fi

#!/bin/bash ################################################################################################# # NAME # install.sh # # LAST MODIFIED # 27-June-2012 # # SYNOPSIS # # DESCRIPTION # This script installs openladp using yum # This script is tested on CentOs 5.6 server 64 bit only. # The following packages are installed # openldap-2.3.43-25.el5 # openldap-servers-2.3.43-25.el5 # openldap-clients-2.3.43-25.el5 # nss_ldap-253-49.el5 # # USAGE # Following environment variables are needed by this script: # 1. global_conf : This is the path to the file https://${darwin.server.ip}:8443/darwin/conf/darwin_global.conf # on the appdirector server # 2. http_proxy : If network uses a proxy for internet access then this needs to be set. # # LICENSE # # AUTHOR # Ankur Goel # Persistent Systems Limited ################################################################################################# # Enables checking of all commands. If a command exits with an error(non-zero status) # and the caller does not check such error, the script aborts immediately set -e
# Import Global conf . $global_conf
export PATH="$PATH:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin"
# Install required packages for openldap server if [ "x$OS" != "x" ] && [ $OS = 'CentOS' ] ; then echo "Installing openldap" yum --nogpgcheck --noplugins -y install openldap openldap-servers openldap-clients nss_ldap else echo "This operating system is not supported" exit 1 fi

ns9:component-version-script.script:
#!/bin/bash # Import global conf . $global_conf
export PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin set -e
# Locate the my.cnf file my_cnf_file= if [ -f /etc/my.cnf ]; then my_cnf_file=/etc/my.cnf elif [ -f /etc/mysql/my.cnf ]; then my_cnf_file=/etc/mysql/my.cnf fi
if [ "x$my_cnf_file" = "x" ]; then echo "Neither /etc/my.cnf nor /etc/mysql/my.cnf can be found, stopping configuration" exit 1 fi
# update mysql configuration to handle big packets sed -ie "s/\[mysqld\]/\[mysqld\]\n\ max_allowed_packet=1024M/g" $my_cnf_file # update listening port sed -ie "s/\[mysqld\]/\[mysqld\]\n\ port=$db_port/g" $my_cnf_file
if [ "x$OS" != "x" ] && [ "$OS" = 'Ubuntu' ]; then # Make sure that MySQL is started service mysql restart else # set up auto-start on booting chkconfig mysqld on # restart mysqld service service mysqld start fi
# this will assign a password for mysql admin user 'root' mysqladmin -u $db_root_username password $db_root_password

#!/bin/bash # Import global conf . $global_conf
export PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin set -e
# Tested on CentOS if [ -x /usr/sbin/selinuxenabled ] && /usr/sbin/selinuxenabled; then # SELinux can be disabled by setting "/usr/sbin/setenforce Permissive" echo 'SELinux in enabled on this VM template. This service requires SELinux to be disabled to install successfully' exit 1 fi
if [ "x$OS" != "x" ] && [ "$OS" = 'Ubuntu' ]; then # Fix the linux-firmware package export DEBIAN_FRONTEND=noninteractive apt-get install -y linux-firmware < /dev/console > /dev/console # Install MySQL package apt-get install -y mysql-server else yum --nogpgcheck --noplugins -y install -x MySQL-server-community mysql-server fi

ns9:component-version-script.description: UPDATE-lifecycle script for changing the MySQL properties
ns9:component-version-script.script:
#!/bin/bash # This is the UPDATE lifecycle script for MySql service to update db_port and/or db_root_password. # If other properties are changed, the script will need to be adjusted accordingly.
echo "MySQL server UPDATE to update db_port and db_root_password"
# Import global conf . $global_conf
export PATH=$PATH:/usr/local/sbin:/usr/local/bin:/usr/sbin:/usr/bin:/sbin:/bin set -e
# Stop the script if unsupported properties updated declare -a unsupported_props for v in ${!APPD_UPDATE_PROPS[*]}; do if [[ `echo "${APPD_UPDATE_PROPS[$v]}" | grep -E "^(db_port|db_root_password)$"` == "" ]]; then unsupported_props+=(${APPD_UPDATE_PROPS[$v]}) fi done if [ ${#unsupported_props[*]} -gt 0 ]; then echo This update script does not support the update of the following properties: ${unsupported_props[*]} exit 1; fi
# update root password if [[ "$APPD_PREV_db_root_password" != "" && "$APPD_PREV_db_root_password" != "$db_root_password" ]]; then echo "update root password" mysqladmin -u $db_root_username -p"$APPD_PREV_db_root_password" password "$db_root_password" fi
# Locate the my.cnf file my_cnf_file= if [ -f /etc/my.cnf ]; then my_cnf_file=/etc/my.cnf elif [ -f /etc/mysql/my.cnf ]; then my_cnf_file=/etc/mysql/my.cnf fi
if [ "x$my_cnf_file" = "x" ]; then echo "Neither /etc/my.cnf nor /etc/mysql/my.cnf can be found, stopping configuration" exit 1 fi
# Run this part of script if 'db_port' property changed. # The APPD_UPDATE_PROPS environment variable contains an array of changed and affected properties. if [[ `echo "${APPD_UPDATE_PROPS[*]}" | grep 'db_port'` != "" ]]; then echo "stop the mysql service before updating the port number" if [ "x$OS" != "x" ] && [ "$OS" = 'Ubuntu' ]; then if [[ `service mysql status` == *running* ]]; then echo "stopping MySQL service..." service mysql stop fi else if [[ `service mysqld status` == *is\ running* ]]; then echo "stopping MySQL service..." service mysqld stop fi fi
echo "update listening port to $db_port" sed -ie "s/port=[0-9]*/port=$db_port/g" $my_cnf_file
# start the mysql service after updating the port number if [ "x$OS" != "x" ] && [ "$OS" = 'Ubuntu' ]; then echo "Make sure that MySQL is started" service mysql start else service mysqld start fi fi
echo "Finished MySQL Server UPDATE"
